sourcesContent:
import React from "react"; import family from "../../../assets/cover/Family.jpg"; function About() { return (

Welcome to our Wishing Well!

First Conversation:

Well most of you may know that Erin and I met at BestBuy where we both worked. After day dreaming about her for months I stumbled upon her sitting alone in the breakroom. I said hello and was greeted with a non enthusiacstic hello. Obviouse that it was not the bestes of days for Erin I decided to try to cheer her up. I Started with the best question you can ask someone who is sad or upset I asked her "what's wrong?". She didn't even give me the time of day and mumbled the socially acceptable answer of "nothing". Only partially conviced by her answer I decided to continue on with my attempt to place her in a better mood by responding, "Well that sounded awefully convicing glad you're doing so well. My day hasn't been too bad, I got like 7K out already and I'm only half way through it!" And that was what got her to finally look up and make eye contact and in the most sincere tone she responded with ,"wow... that is so awesome... cool... congrats?.." But I could see in her eye at this point that I needed to really m ake her smile so I whipped out one of the best jokes in the books. I was a gentleman however and warned her that its more enjoyable to tell and asked who she lived with. She responded "my mom." So I told her I am going to tell her the best joke ever!!! and she has to tell her mom tonight, once asking her to agree multiple times she finally agreed (although now that I think about it I think it was to get me to shut up cause she was having a pretty crappy day).

And so it began...
A bear walks into a bar.
Goes up to the bartender.
The bear slams his paws on the counter and says I'll have a glace of water..
*long awkard pause (I was kind and only did 15 seconds althought my record is over 2 days. Started the joke on the way to colorado and finished it on our way back)*
...With ice! bartender looks at the bear.
He asks the bear, "Whats with the big pause?"
Bear lifts up his paws and goes "I'm a bearrrr!!!"

To my surpose not even a smile or a chuckle... I assumed I failed and tucked my tail between my legs and left the breakroom after only 3 minutes. The next day I walked into the break room and saw Erin there again. After a good nights sleep and a fresh shower I had a bit more confidence in me to continue my attempt to swoon her with my charm. I asked if she told her mom that joke I told her yesterday and to my surprise she did... I asked how was it what did she say!? Erin responded well "she kind of just staired at me very confused then said, 'well Erin, I'm glad you're making friends' then she walked away".

Background

I got my first job when I was 12 years old cleaning houses when Peoplee moved out. I later worked my way into retail where I have been a manager for the past 8 of my 10 years in retail, most recently with BestBuy. Due to wanting to be challenged in a new way and seeking a more long term satisfaction in my work, I started my training to become a Full Stack Web Developer. I have recently completed The Full Stack Web Development bootcamp offered through the University of Oregon. It has allowed me to develop technical skills in JavaScript, CSS and HTML. Throughout this bootcamp I have been able to advance my Technical Skills and create PWA (Progressive Web Applications) and other apps using Node.js, React, GraphQL, MongoBD, MySQL. NoSQL, and MERN (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js). I am a critical thinker who pays attention to detail and adds excitement and creativity to everything I do. Because of my love for math, I enjoy problem solving, debugging, modularizing and providing solutions or insight to others. I work well in a team and can naturally guide a team to success, I also excel on my own and enjoy a good challenge of my strengths and weaknesses. I have found my passion as a full stack web developer and am excited to work in an environment that challenges me everyday. I am here to overcome company obstacles and create a more profitable and sustainable work environment as a full stack web developer.{" "}

Future

I want to be challenged, due to my attention to detail and creative thinking I want to create new projects and improve on existing ones. I enjoy debugging and finding ways to improve usage and efficiency of existing applications. I want to work in a strong team environment that supports, challenges and adds value to each other's work and lives every day. I want to be a part of something big and be able to make a difference with the work I provide. I want to be your next asset.{" "}

); } export default About;
